scenario: Sarah stood in her kitchen, staring at the half-demolished wall between the dining room and living space. The contractor had abandoned the job three weeks ago, leaving exposed wiring and a pile of drywall sheets. Her sister Maya arrived with coffee and tools, ready to tackle the mess. Sarah complained bitterly about the timeline and expressed serious doubts about ever finishing the renovation. The structural beam overhead creaked ominously whenever anyone walked upstairs. Maya listened to Sarah's concerns and offered support, and by the end of the afternoon Sarah had stopped catastrophizing about the project.

scenario: During the library's annual fundraiser, Sarah noticed the old display case near the entrance was wobbling dangerously whenever patrons walked by. The antique wooden frame had loosened screws and seemed ready to topple over, which made her anxious about potential accidents. Meanwhile, volunteer coordinator Mark was overwhelmed with his mounting tasks - organizing donor packets, coordinating the silent auction, and managing the evening's schedule. Several donors had already complained about the delayed start time, and Mark's position on rushing the event was causing disagreement among the planning committee. When Tom arrived, he assessed the situation and offered his support, spending time adjusting the case's base mechanism until it stood firmly in place.
label: structural

The cooling system had been acting up all week, and there were heated disagreements among the team about whether to risk continuing or shut down operations. She offered her support, and by the end of the afternoon Marcus felt more confident about the inspection process.

scenario: During parent-teacher conferences at Lincoln Elementary, Mrs. Rodriguez sat across from her daughter Sofia's teacher, Ms. Chen. scenario: At the city council meeting, Margaret was visibly stressed about the proposed development timeline, worried about missing the environmental review deadline. The project required extensive documentation and equipment assessments. When Margaret's colleague offered support during the heated discussion, she found herself thinking more clearly about the situation.

The deadline to finish repairs before the city inspection was causing stress among volunteers. Jake disagreed with the plan to replace it entirely, arguing they should just patch it. label: structural
